de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.processor.runtime.module.model
Interface IInterpreterRegistry

All Known Implementing Classes:
InterpreterRegistry, InterpreterRegistry, InterpreterRegistryImpl
public interface IInterpreterRegistry

Internal registry for interpreter classes. Provides access to interpreter instances for all TMQL-expression types.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Summary
 IExpressionInterpreter<?> interpreterInstance(IExpression ex)
          Method try to create a instance of the interpreter, which is used to interpret the TMQL-expression of the given type
<T extends IExpression>
void
registerInterpreterClass(java.lang.Class<T> expressionClass, java.lang.Class<? extends IExpressionInterpreter<T>> interpreterClass)
          Method is used to register a new interpreter module for a TMQL-expression type.
 

Method Detail

interpreterInstance

IExpressionInterpreter<?> interpreterInstance(IExpression ex)
                                              throws TMQLRuntimeException
Method try to create a instance of the interpreter, which is used to interpret the TMQL-expression of the given type

Parameters:
ex - the expression which should be interpret by the new interpreter
Returns:
a new interpreter instance and never null
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if no interpreter class is registered for the given expression type

registerInterpreterClass

<T extends IExpression> void registerInterpreterClass(java.lang.Class<T> expressionClass,
                                                      java.lang.Class<? extends IExpressionInterpreter<T>> interpreterClass)
                              throws TMQLInitializationException
Method is used to register a new interpreter module for a TMQL-expression type.

Parameters:
expressionClass - the TMQL-expression type
interpreterClass - the new interpreter module class
Throws:
TMQLException - thrown if at least one parameter is null
TMQLInitializationException
